name: mismeasurement
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] a failure to measure the size, amount, value, or importance of something correctly: The cases involve allegations of mismeasurement and undervaluation of gas volumes on which royalty payments are due. Mis-measurement of tariffs is also captured in the model.
[ C ] an incorrect value relating to the size, amount, or importance of something: These are inadvertent mismeasurements and miscalculations. The lower the quality of the image, the higher the chance of mis-measurements. Related word
mismeasure
More examplesFewer examplesIt is possible that this is an illusion caused by the mismeasurement of exports.We must take into account any potential mismeasurement. A system is more likely to have high reliability if it is free of unintended or intended mismeasurement or error.
